alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 7:12PM EDT until May 04 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is Forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35,000.0 cfs, Flooding begins at campgrounds in Skowhegan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EDT Tuesday the flow was 47,000.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM EDT Tuesday was 76,000.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river has crested at around 76,000 cfs. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
